problem: Given triangle ABC with vertices A(-3, 2), B(4, 5), and C(1, -6), find the slope of the equation of the line that is the perpendicular bisector of side BC.
solution: To find the slope of the perpendicular bisector of side BC with points B(4,5) and C(1,-6), calculate the slope of BC: \( m_{BC} = \frac{y_C - y_B}{x_C - x_B} = \frac{-6 - 5}{1 - 4} = \frac{-11}{-3} = \frac{11}{3} \); the perpendicular bisector's slope is the negative reciprocal, so \( m = \boxed{-\frac{3}{11}} \).
